info.michaelkohler.helpertools.string

Class StringHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.michaelkohler.helpertools.string.StringHelper

  • public final class StringHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    The |StringHelper| is a static class which helps performing useful operations on strings easily and efficiently.
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Lukas Diener

    • Method Summary

      Counts the occurrences of a character in a given string.

      Creates a continuous string out of a String array and a separator.

      Add a character after a string until it reaches the given length.
      static java.lang.String prepad(java.lang.String s, int length, char c)
      Add a character in front of a string until it reaches the given length.
      static java.lang.String prepadNumber(int i, int length)
      Add 0 (null) in front of a number until it reaches the given length.
      static java.lang.String replaceWithoutRepetition(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String find, java.lang.String replace)

                    java.lang.String separator)
        Creates a continuous string out of a String array and a separator.
        Parameters:
        items - string array to join
        separator - the separator to use between the elements
        Returns:

      • countChar

        public static int countChar(java.lang.String text,
            char character)
        Counts the occurrences of a character in a given string.
        Parameters:
        text - the text in which to search
        character - the character to match
        Returns:
        number of occurrences

      • prepad

        public static java.lang.String prepad(java.lang.String s,
                      int length,
                      char c)
        Add a character in front of a string until it reaches the given length. When the string is longer than the specified length, the string is returned as-is.
        Parameters:
        s - the source string
        length - the desired length of the final string
        c - the character to fill in
        Returns:
        the pre-padded string

      • prepadNumber

        public static java.lang.String prepadNumber(int i,
                            int length)
        Add 0 (null) in front of a number until it reaches the given length. When the number is longer than the specified length, the number is returned as-is.
        Parameters:
        i - the source number
        length - the desired length of the final string
        Returns:
        the pre-padded number

      • postpad

        public static java.lang.String postpad(java.lang.String s,
                       int length,
                       char c)
        Add a character after a string until it reaches the given length. When the string is longer than the specified length, the string is returned as-is.
        Parameters:
        s - the source string
        length - the desired length of the final string
        c - the character to fill in
        Returns:
        the post-padded string

      • replaceWithoutRepetition

        public static java.lang.String replaceWithoutRepetition(java.lang.String text,
                                        java.lang.String find,
                                        java.lang.String replace)
        Replace all occurrences of a String within another without repeating parts of the string. Example: Replacing "Obama" with "Barack Obama" in "Barack Obama is the president of the U, S and A. Obama has a dog." results in "Barack Obama is the president of the U, S and A. Barack Obama has a dog."
        Parameters:
        text - the text in which to search
        find - the string to find
        replace - the replacement
        Returns:
        the new string
